Posts.Content: Supersonic_Woman wrote: This is about the 4th time that I have logged on today to start a note.  I am feeling a little lost.  I live alone and really have no one to talk to.  Except possibly my dog and she is currently out like a light on the sofa.  I received a notice for my annual mammo (which I haven't had done for about 3 years) in August.  I thought that this time I am going to do it.  About 2 weeks ago I was getting ready to shower and noticed a very large bruise on my right breast.  It seemed to come from nowhere - I don't remember hurting it.  The bruise has not really changed in 2 weeks.  It is not a "normal" bruise.  It has not turned purple or brown or green but remains a bright red.  So I start looking on google and of course come up with IBC.  Then a little pink mark shows up on the same breast about 2 days ago.  So now I really start to worry.  I don't seem to have any other symptons - no discharge, no puckering.  The only thing that may have changed is the areola on that breast seems to be stretching.  I am scheduled for my mammo on Tuesday, but in the meantime, I am scaring myself silly.  I guess I just needed to. unload and there is probably nothing wrong.  I am 58, post menopausal (I think - still having a lot of hot flashes 14 years after my last period), divorced and no children.  Also have been having abnormal pap smears for the last 2 years. There are an awful lot of brave women on this site.  My heart goes out to so many and I can't get over the courage of these women, and in spite of their own problems, the support they offer to others Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: A little frightened Supersonic_Woman Ariom
